I cant sit back and watch the government destroy web3 (well at least in the USA).

So I have decided to join @Lobby3D.

The average age of a US senator is 53. I want my voice heard for my future. Crypto/web3 is here to stay and regulation will decide if it prospers in the USA. https://t.co/u4gFAgNHrW

Brantly voting against his own removal at ENS... One side of me is like well if people didn't change who they delegated to then they must be ok with him using his votes as such.

The other side of me feels like this Russia vetoing the UN Security Council which it was a target of https://t.co/s5nwfTqTzd

As I learn/reflect more about myself and meet others.

It's the optimistic people that are all board web3. And it's the people that care about the collective.

I'm not made for a dog eat dog world. Let's all lift each other up.

Like @garyvee says, give the haters kindness

WAGMI

My thoughts go out to all those involved in Ukraine.

I am without words.

This conflict will cause broken hearts for years to come. https://t.co/I6gGGNoDTa

In the first tweet I meant oversold and overbought.

I'm tired.

Gn

Ethereum will live on beyond our lifetime. I'm not worried in the slightest.

I would be putting my money where my mouth is but I need to solidify my taxes first.

In 5 years I have no doubt $2,400 will seem so cheap. That it was so obvious.

This chart goes back to 2016.

Going oversold was a once in lifetime opportunity to buy ETH.

Below 40 weekly RSI (we are currently at 38) has been still been great times to buy for the long term.

If you believe in ETH, and have the liquidity, you should be adding here. https://t.co/Ff3MiuxmaC

I still think weekly RSI is a great indicator to help when to buy.

I put these lines on this chart over 6 months ago. Marking when weekly RSI went oversold and then oversold in the last bear market.

Then marked the high and the lows of the bear market. https://t.co/9Fk5xa3SJl

I don't care if all my crypto goes to 0.

I will move on with my life, and keep working a secure job that I love for the next 20 years. Then enjoy retirement. 

It will be great stories about how we were trading digital art for crazy amounts of internet money.

But what if...

Well done! This is crazy innovative. I love seeing this space moving at the speed of light.

First time seeing @mattereum and I want to learn more.

Hope the auction goes well to the owner of the OG ape my mutant was created from. https://t.co/D6nQ1LKtvI

RT @sassal0x: Hard truth: crypto investing is incredibly difficult & most people aren't going to make it

You need to hold assets that you‚Ä¶

Web3 is first a value/money revolution in my mind, but also a information revolution.

Not all revolutions lead to smooth transition of power or wealth.

@RugRadio @farokh comes first to mind but this is not targeted at just you.

All web3 should work towards more self-reliance.

To notch this up even more.

I'm advocating for the use @permacastapp on @ArweaveTeam

For less than $1, the eposide can forever be put on the blockchain, out of reach of centralized providers, social media, and governments.

And can still be listened to with current apps.

Right now to find a Twitter space recording you have to hope it was recorded, then find someone that shared it on their feed (who knows how many tweets they have already done since).

That's if you knew about the space.

The information in spaces should not feel like one time use

RSS feeds aka podcasts.

They are super convenient, Spotify, ITunes, Pocket Casts(bunch of third-party apps) recieve these RSS feeds and automatically refresh the latest and greatest.

And users can customize how they want to get notified, or download eposides automatically.

Before it's needed. That way if the censorship happens, then it's a easy transition to backups.

Instead of transtioning to new backups with no official forms of communications.

Heres what I'm advocating for...

The most recent example, look at Canada's government response to @brian_armstrong and @jespow education to self custody wallets.

Hint they were not big fans.

What if web2 starts censoring crypto/web3 from pressures of governments?

The infrastructure should be laid now.

Ok I don't want to sound paranoid.

But it would great to see web3/crypto /NFTs, Twitter Spaces and Discords calls be backed up in a way that insures they will always be there.

Right now there is so much riding on discord and Twitter allowing web3/crypto to use their platforms.

#CryptoMories #FaMorie

https://t.co/LL8TVjQWUj

Fire sale on a clean robot. 2 ETH.

Feeling over invested in Cryptomories (I have 2 others), plus looking to work in web3 long term and focusing on networking opportunities.

NWO has not been minted.

Hope it goes to a good home!üòÅ

Dont forget that NFTs are the first time you have digitally been able to own something that is nonfungible.

Before you rented/borrowed digital items, with permission from the worlds biggest corporations. As long as you played by their rules, made them money.

#BAYC has been arguably "the" NFT that has hit mainstream adoption. The most well known collection/most pop culture significant.

In future when this new project launches, everyone will be interested.

Because you are not going to miss the new from the team that made BAYC.

@harrycanuck Close but just south/touching the BC/Washington border in Washington. 

Good eye though.

It's amazing what NFTs have done for crypto/web3.

Going from the #Lobby3 Discord call to the #BAYC Mega Mutant Reveal Twitter space.

So much going on, can't keep up with it all!

It's all got me so hyped for the future. So much passion everywhere.

Reading all the takes on ETHDenver I am a little bummed I missed out.

No one in my IRL gives two fucks about crypto/web3.

But I have been grinding for 4.25 years soaking up as much as I can.

I need to start surrounding myself with those that care like I do, not just virtually.

It's one of those projects, that I joined the discord (to look at the announcements). But kinda didn't care what the price did in the short term.

I still feel the same way. Long term focused.

I don't say that lightly but DAOs and decentralized platforms will be just be able to grow and expand at such a more rapid pace than web2 media.

I was not about to sit on the sidelines any longer without a Rug NFT, I want to be a part of RugDAO.

(13/14)

To wrap this mega thread up. 

Where to I see @RugRadio going in the future?

As the NFT space grows, I could see this become as big as ViacomCBS/Paramount Global (which has brands like CBS, The CW,MTV, BET, Comedy Central, and Showtime) ($15.3b USD in total equity).

(12/14)

Overall the web3 space has a very high barrier to entry. Its all very confusing.

Education will attract all kinds of people to the platform, and with them fresh new ideas.

The way web3 is exponential, is really hard to comprehend.

(10/14)

Then you have @Ledger. Which has given me the piece of mind to be able to go bankless with my crypto. I see standalone hardware wallets here for good.

Things integrated into phones are connected to too many attack vectors.

Ledger is leading this security avenue for now

(9/14)

not have to know a lot about programming (or not nearly as much) to create NFTs with apps build into them. 

Look at @lostpoetsocy and REPLICATOR by @Mad_Dog_Jones as collabs they have already done.

Next lets talk about their new earn to learn series going on. Which I just listened to the first one.

The collaborations with @SyndicateDAO, @manifoldxyz, and @Ledger will be incredible.

@manifoldxyz in particular is very interesting as it allows creators/artists to...

The more that come on and it goes well, the more attractive the platform gets for future high quality interviewees.

(5/14)

hear his passion. But then that is perfectly balanced by @belikewater893 with a very clear level voice of reason explaining tokenomics and just makes things make sense.

Its really something you need to listen to (the bouncing off each other) to really understand.

With so many different hosts, there will be space for anyone interested in web3 to find their niche.

Speaking of I think the team of @farokh and @belikewater893 is so perfect. @farokh has the hype vibe, its so up beat and is very exciting, you can..

I remember reading the initial goal is 50 shows/hosts.

And could definitely see 24/7 content in the future.

(2/14)

And I understand why many would like to change bitcoin as little as possible, as it makes it easier to design a world around it and know that in 100 years it will be the same.

I just simply think the end game planning/theory was implemented too early.

I disagree that bitcoin will be the unit of money for the world because it doesn't change.

What if we never went from dial up (AOL) to broadband internet?

I don't think we should keep perpetuating the first blockchain that doesn't innovate for the sake of sound money policy.
